results.title: The Magic machines & other tricks
results.creator_credit: Joan Keller Stern, Fly-By-Night Productions and Bob Curtis
results.brief_description: The work of Robert Gilbert, sculptor, we hear his voice as the camera examines his work, his tools and the leftover junk and objects which he assembles into his colourful kinetic sculpture. We see the work displayed in various places - on a truck riding along the freeway - in an elevator and in one painful sequence at Century Plaza, Los Angeles where we see “MACHINE JUNE 23”, work which commemorates the brutal confrontation between police and demonstrators on that day.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joan Keller Stern, Fly-By-Night Productions and Bob Curtis

results.title: The Magic key
results.creator_credit: Campbell Harper Films and Scottish Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: Describes the progress of industrial research in Scotland and shows how better methods of technology have affected every sphere of life. Scientists and research workers have collaborated with the Scottish Council of Development and Industry to perfect new ideas and techniques, and to produce improved commodities. Their work has already resulted in a contribution to the country’s export drive and an enrichment of the daily life of the people.

results.title: The Magic house
results.brief_description: Two parents abandon their responsibilities: at first their children are happy with this but over several days the attitude of the girl changes. Open-ended film which leaves many possibilities for discussion. Good for values study. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Magic hankies
results.creator_credit: Heinrich Fueter, Condor Films and Otto Ritter
results.brief_description: The story of Swiss handkerchief embroidery is woven into scenes of local life. Although machines are now used, this old traditional art is still carried on in Alpine homes. In a Swiss home on Christmas eve, Uncle makes a handkerchief disappear. He conjures up scenes of where it may travel; to a Paris salon; a NeweYork nightclub; a garden in Spain; or even at the home of a geisha in Japan. Focuses on the Appenzell region of Switzerland in the vicinity of Zurich.

results.title: The Magic Flute
results.brief_description: Ever since its first performance in 1791, Mozart’s “The Magic Flute” has remained a favourite with opera audiences worldwide. Australian born Yvonne Kenny gives a radiant performance as Parina, with the world renowned Richard Bonynge conducting Mozart’s magical score. Featuring the Australian Opera Chorus and the Elizabethan Sydney Orchestra. Sung in English.

results.title: The Magic fiddle
results.creator_credit: Jon Mathisen, Norway. Ministry of Education and Michael Forlong
results.brief_description: A Norwegian ballet based on one of the old folk tales of Norway. A peasant boy gives away his last shilling to a beggar who turns into a magician and gives him a magic fiddle which, when played, makes everyone dance. Features the Norwegian Ballet and the choreography of Gerd Kjolaas.

results.title: The Magic boomerang: Double trouble
results.creator_credit: Roger Mirams, David Baker and Pacific Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Magic Boomerang”.
One of a series made for children’s television. The story is set in a country town where the boy “hero” of the series, Nuggett, gets involved in a plot to defraud a man of some land. The whole plot is thwarted with the help of Nuggett and his friend and the magic boomerang. The owner and his land are saved in a happy ending.

results.title: The Magic billabong
results.creator_credit: Barbara Graham Productions and Garry Gibson
results.brief_description: Featuring koalas, kangaroos, echidnas and other Australian wildlife in their natural habitat. Ann Patchett presents information, songs, magic, games, counting and camping with Kookie and the Gumnut Babies, plus story reading from award winning children’s books including “Possum magic” as well as plenty of ideas for exciting things to do.
